title: Language, Communication and Knowledge in International Business and Management
abstractText: This seminar series focuses on international and global business contexts and the role of the English language in facilitating management and practitioner communications across cultural and linguistic boundaries. In addition to the role of English as a communicative device, the role of 'other languages' in the creation and sharing of global knowledge will also be discussed. Here, the role of English will be critically examined as it privileges certain perspectives and worldviews over those expressed and constructed through 'other languages'. The contributions of speakers focus on the role of languages in multinational co-operations, the role of languages on the thinking  and practices of international managers and also covers language diversity and the role of English in particular sectors (e.g. tourism management in Eastern Europe) and corporate functions (talent management, HR).
